title: How to Roll Silverware in a Linen Napkin

steps.headline: Place all utensils into small container full of soda water.
Polish and dry all utensils and set on clean flat surface.
Create stacks of 1 steak knife and 2 forks, with the steak knife on bottom.
Place linen on workspace with one corner pointing towards you.
Pick up the corner pointing towards you and fold it in half diagonally.
steps.description: The napkin now resembles a triangle.

steps.headline: Place a utensil stack  approximately 2 inches (5.1 cm) from, and parallel to, the bottom edge of the triangle.
steps.description: Center stack 'side to side' on the linen napkin.

steps.headline: Fold the bottom 2 inches (5.1 cm) of the triangle edge over the utensil stack, and hold in place.
Fold left corner of triangle from left to right over the utensil stack, hold in place.
Fold right corner of triangle from right to left over the utensil stack, hold in place.
Roll covered stack tightly away from you.

text: Place all utensils into small container full of soda water.  Soak for 3 minutes.  Polish and dry all utensils and set on clean flat surface.  Create stacks of 1 steak knife and 2 forks, with the steak knife on bottom.  Place linen on workspace with one corner pointing towards you.  Pick up the corner pointing towards you and fold it in half diagonally. The napkin now resembles a triangle. Place a utensil stack  approximately 2 inches (5.1 cm) from, and parallel to, the bottom edge of the triangle. Center stack 'side to side' on the linen napkin. Fold the bottom 2 inches (5.1 cm) of the triangle edge over the utensil stack, and hold in place.  Fold left corner of triangle from left to right over the utensil stack, hold in place.  Fold right corner of triangle from right to left over the utensil stack, hold in place.  Roll covered stack tightly away from you.  Finished.
